@IanCao Good catch. I have discussed with @ascrutae , we think we should
1. Add a stack-based flag in the running context.
1. Only create Entry Span when this flag does not exist.
1. Create Local Span when flag exists.
1. Clear running context(request/response) if flag is reset to 0.

What do you think?
OK~~

OpenTracing just asked the implementor to provide the tracer and related APIs. So, only this related to SkyWalking API.

SkyWalking-OT is a bridge, you still need to install the agent. In SkyWalking, we only recommend you to use OT when you want to add you new local span.
Don't use OT API instrument lib and OT API to instrument RPC. We have plenty auto-instrumentation plugins, which will work better and no code injection.
You could follow the pull request related to this.
I don't know why you can't ali Cloud Elasticsearch. Please check by yourself.
If I want to use ali Cloud, is there any problem with my configuration?
That part I don't know...

> Can I configure alarm rules through the UI? Customize alarms through the UI?

Can't, today.

> Can only be fixed Config/ Alarm -settings.yml Configuration Alert?

I don't understand this question.

> Can be configured with multiple Alarm -settings.yml ?

No. Why do you need multiple files?

> Is there an alarm message or email to notify the relevant person?

Please use webhook in the alarm module.  You could do anything in there. Based on ASF 2.0, I can't use commercial message protocol.

For the second question
Excuse me, I want to express the alarm rules that must be configured in this file?

How to use webhook  ? Can provide the use of the document connection address
?

> For the second question
Excuse me, I want to express the alarm rules that must be configured in this file?

Yes. Right now it is.

> How to use webhook ? Can provide the use of the document connection address?

It is already included in `alarm-settings.yml`. such as
```
webhooks:
  - http://127.0.0.1/notify/
```

The target endpoint could receive the alarm message in HTTP request body in JSON format.

thank you very much

I queried the relevant information, for example.   https://skywalking.apache.org/zh/blog/2019-01-03-monitor-microservice.html

The target endpoint could receive the alarm message in HTTP request body in JSON format.

Can I configure alarm message to send through the UI?

> How to use webhook ? Can provide the use of the document connection address?

No, you can't.
If you dynamically modify alarm-settings.yml, do you need to restart the service?

> If you dynamically modify alarm-settings.yml, do you need to restart the service?

Right now, Yes.

> Agent reports its timezone in register and heartbeat, in default, treated as backend timezone for back-forward compatible. But I hope Java, .net, nodejs, php, go agents could adopte this.
If we use gRPC, I think the best practice is that at the first segment of streaming the agent is designed to report timezone.
> Service Mesh receiver, especially istio and envoy receiver need to transfer time based on timezone in the timestamp. @hanahmily <https://github.com/hanahmily>For service mesh, eg. istio mixer,envoy, there’s no chance to grab timezone of senders. But a good news for us is they are both deployed in docker whose default timezone is GTM(UTC-0), especially envoy’s access log is [designed to support it](https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/3546 <https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/3546>).So the details should be declared in our documents.




> On Apr 30, 2019, at 8:08 AM, 吴晟 Wu Sheng <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Hi
> 
> Today, SkyWalking time mechanism relied on the agent, backend, and UI in the same time zone, but still facing issues. Because of the time in agent traces, it is hard to make it accurate in the query.
> 
> In 6.2, I want to do this, which related to agent, backend and UI changes.
> 
> Agent reports its timezone in register and heartbeat, in default, treated as backend timezone for back-forward compatible. But I hope Java, .net, nodejs, php, go agents could adopte this. @ascrutae <https://github.com/ascrutae> @liuhaoyang <https://github.com/liuhaoyang> @hanahmily <https://github.com/hanahmily> @heyanlong <https://github.com/heyanlong>
> Service Mesh receiver, especially istio and envoy receiver need to transfer time based on timezone in the timestamp. @hanahmily <https://github.com/hanahmily>
> OAP backend will transfer time format to UTC-0 always and save in storage.
> OAP query parameter and result are all based on UTC-0, UI needs to change time visualization based on browser timezone. Also, because of this, I think no need to choose timezone anymore. @TinyAllen <https://github.com/TinyAllen>
> —

>

> If we use gRPC, I think the best practice is that at the first segment of streaming the agent is designed to report timezone.

But it will break all agent protocol, which will be a disaster. See what happens in 5.0->6.0, some agents are still not fitting the new protocol. I really don't want to do that.

It seems an extension far more than a breaking. I means if the agent has adopted the new protocol cloud send timezone, other agent could use old ways to send data. In other word, the oap makes an assumption that all data received is belonging to GTM unless it gets the exact timezone of the agent.

> It seems an extension far more than a breaking. I means if the agent has adopted the new protocol cloud send timezone, other agent could use old ways to send data. In other word, the oap makes an assumption that all data received is belonging to GTM unless it gets the exact timezone of the agent.

Then you need to extend all agent protocol as 6.0 did. Because all agent protocols include time. Also,y, you should known, in gRPC/protobuf, the naming will become very hard. Because span/segment need to be renamed again.

>  In other word, the oap makes an assumption that all data received is belonging to GTM unless it gets the exact timezone of the agent.

@hanahmily You can't. Because old agents base on OS time only.
English only, 6.1 is on the way, please retry there.

lol…
What we discussed is not a same thing. I proposed a common practice, not refer any existing API. If the API we will extend is base on streaming what I propose will work.

> What we discussed is not a same thing. I proposed a common practice, not refer any existing API. If the API we will extend is base on streaming what I propose will work.

Not all APIs are based on streaming, just trace API does. We could extend the protocol, by adding a new field and hope gRPC works. It will relate to
- Register service/instance/endpoint
- Trace
- JVM/CLR
- Heartbeat

> How to handle them? If we document if user change os time to GTM, the OAP will work fine?

That is the issue. We haven't a perfect way to handle it, especially at trace page. That is why I proposed this. Because the browser time zone can't be in the time zone. We must find a way to do time  format Standardization.
thks, when 6.1 will release?
We are always welcome to new plugin contribution. You could try to build one and contribute to the community. We have well-documented steps to do so.

> That is the issue. We haven't a perfect way to handle it, especially at trace page. That is why I proposed this. Because the browser time zone can't be in the time zone. We must find a way to do time format Standardization.
> 

So we should document it well. If OAP save data as UTC, some user might not query data when upgrade their backend. There’re a lot of issues about the same thing in Prometheus community event though maintainers have document it and provide FAQ.

> 
> What we discussed is not a same thing. I proposed a common practice, not refer any existing API. If the API we will extend is base on streaming what I propose will work.

> 
> Register service/instance/endpoint
> Trace
> JVM/CLR
> Heartbeat
> How to handle them? If we document if user change os time to GTM, the OAP will work fine?
> 
> That is the issue. We haven't a perfect way to handle it, especially at trace page. That is why I proposed this. Because the browser time zone can't be in the time zone. We must find a way to do time format Standardization.

> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2560#issuecomment-487795775>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAO6UWO2ADR45SUEP764PTLPS6M6XANCNFSM4HJHT5KA>.
>

> So we should document it well. If OAP save data as UTC, some user might not query data when upgrade their backend. There’re a lot of issues about the same thing in Prometheus community event though maintainers have document it and provide FAQ.

No, it wouldn't. That is whole point of this proposal. Because UI will adopt the client side timezone. Query time and result time are based on UTC, and UI changes it to browser timezone. 
Make sense?
Could you please provide the document for developing  plugins.
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/README.md#project-extensions

I doubt it…
For a scenario that local Chinese team have a plan to upgrade skywalking. If their old OAP instances use UTC+8. Data sending time is 8:00:00(UTC+8), the new OAP save as 8:00:00(UTC+0).If end user also in the same timezone, the UI transform query time 8:00:00(UTC+8) to 0:00:00(UTC+0). So the user can not query any data.

Yes. the proposal have point out that the agent should report timezone. But If we want provide some backward compatibility that’s what we should figure out.How to fix it? the user should set OAP instance to use UTC that should be well documented for upgrading.

For service mesh, eg. istio mixer,envoy, there’s no chance to grab timezone of senders. But a good news for us is they are both deployed in docker whose default timezone is UTC, especially envoy’s access log is [designed to support it](https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/3546 <https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/3546>).So the details should be declared in our documents.

> Make sense?

That is true.
We don't support `BaggageItem`, it will be a big payload for the agent. Are you trying to use SkyWalking propagate business info?

@wu-sheng 这个问题怎么解决
Please learn from Vert.x and gRPC stream plugins. Async and sync are working in a different way.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23102976/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23102976)

Coverage increased (+0.002%) to 16.011% when pulling **5e10589530e7ac76b0e6e72d9bae43d2b6fc43d1 on release-fix** into **9b87086d720959f0061914feccb280a958acc805 on master**.
Is there any documentation for reference? grpc or vert.x has no comments, it is difficult to understand what he wants to express @wu-sheng

For APIs, we have detailed documents about plugin development. What else do you need? Across thread is comples, you need to decide
1. Use capture/continued(grpc stream)
Or
2. Set span async and finish in another thread(vert.x)

I can't give a simple choose. You need understand trace and APIs.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23110186/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23110186)

Coverage increased (+0.002%) to 16.231% when pulling **dde76a1b6addb5ae61a96fb1de6f39ce9a7dc2fb on sqldb-alarm** into **4b19bd77cf02831875d91a9b4084b890506f6ff0 on master**.
Run `tar -xvf`, there is no zip there.
When you are ready, please ping me or @ascrutae

We don't support that as people(contributors) are more interesting in our auto-instrumentation agents. Few use OpenTracing, only some use OpenTracing API to adapt their business APIs, such as add some Local Spans only.

Could you tell me why you need the OT API?

We could accept the upgrade Pull Request, but I don't think any core team member(PMC or committer) is working on this.
Even you use OT API, you are still talking to agent core directly. Meaning, you must make sure your way of using OT API is compatible with the mechanism of agent tracing context runs.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23226345/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23226345)

Coverage remained the same at 16.416% when pulling **702296a0ccfe618ed073482d9d323685e0e53c72 on saravanan-kandaswamy:apm-data-unit-test** into **4e710857a08f90792b75ec5fc5d4d1696f2bbcc1 on apache:master**.

I am currently in the process for writing the [OT extension](https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-observability) for the integration network/integration programming called ballerina [[1]
](http://ballerina.io); The language support native OT support thus, I wanted to include the apache skywalking as a part of the extension available. Going forward, What is your recommendation? Using only the agent does not give the whole tracing feature that available OOB via ballerina.

[1] http://ballerina.io 
[2] https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-observability

For the record initing the submodule will solve this issue.
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/How-to-build.md
Could you try to add more jdk and OS versions to travis yml?
Maybe I need to set other CI platform to support windows compile. @liuhaoyang

@saravanan-kandaswamy Please help us verify this PR. I don't have windows and many jdk versions at local. Need you work on CI to support those and avoid this in the future.

> 
> 
> @saravanan-kandaswamy Please help us verify this PR. I don't have windows and many jdk versions at local. Need you work on CI to support those and avoid this in the future.

I have no knowledge on Travis-CI, i do know Jenkins though, let me know what kind of activity i need to do to setup the CI for windows.
Submodules shouldn't be updated.

Please take a look at #2570 , and open multiple jdk and os versions, including the #2570 fix.
I want to check whether the tests could pass.

I think I need some help. I don't know why the change list contains the submodule because I only add some unit tests. 
Can you give me some suggestions to solve the problem?

I think we update submodule to older version. From the latest to your local version.
Two ways,
1. Read git document and update them again to master submodule commit id.
2. Fork from master again.
What kind of support do you need?

SkyWalking wouldn't provide SDK in short term, because no one really try to do and use that. Most tracing and observability should be able to be done by agent, because it is injecting tracing codes too. 
We are supporting most popular RPC frameworks.
